intro_text: The patrol is on edge after scenting Twolegs in the area. p_l is taking point, cautiously keeping watch for any Twolegs that may be on the hunt for cats. Their scent is everywhere, even as the cats carefully remark the area. What's that smell? It's almost like pumpkin, but strange...
decline_text: p_l knows better than to mess with anything that smells like Twolegs. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} carefully {VERB/p_l/skirt/skirts} the area.

success_outcomes.text: p_l follows the scent and nearly treads on the sticky thing in the grass. Definitely a weird Twoleg thing. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} carefully {VERB/p_l/walk/walks} around it, unwilling to get the sticky stuff in {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} fur.

p_l finds the sticky thing in the grass and looks at it curiously. s_c suddenly appears beside {PRONOUN/p_l/object} and, before p_l can tell {PRONOUN/s_c/object} to be careful, s_c bends down and takes a lick. This proves to be a bad idea. s_c wrinkles {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} nose and gags, trying to spit the disgusting taste out of {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} mouth.

fail_outcomes.text: As p_l creeps closer to get a better look, a sudden crashing and loud chattering fills the air. p_l freezes as a pack of Twolegs stumbles through the trees. The cats quickly scatter, leaving behind whatever that weird thing was in the grass.

intro_text: Here on the plains, the reaches of c_n's territory is vast, particularly in the direction p_l and {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol are heading, where there is endless grass but no permanent water sources. Still, with the grass at it's leaf-fall maximum, the sun isn't going to be able to touch p_l's pelt.
decline_text: The patrol is interrupted by a hunting patrol that needs help carrying prey back to camp - border marking will wait til later.

success_outcomes.text: There's a flock of seed eaters that've apparently taken residence up near the distant border, when the patrol finally pads out that far. It's worth noting, and p_l will report the potential hunting spot when they return to camp.

s_c isn't just talented at running fast - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} some very good advice about finding paths in thick grass too and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/share/shares} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tips for endurance. The other cats purr gratitude at the end of the day. Everyone's exhausted, but they made it the entire length of that far off border thanks to s_c.
p_l really pushes them, to be able to patrol all the far border in a single patrol. They make it, and are congratulated on the achivement when they come back into camp after dark, panting.

fail_outcomes.text: They trek, and they wander, and they amble, and they pad. But as the sun creeps over the sky, before they reach the far border itself, p_l spots r_c limping. it's nothing, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/say/says}, just sleeping on the leg wrong. But far from camp isn't the right place to be limping, and p_l calls the patrol off.

Before they reach the far border itself, p_l spots s_c limping. it's nothing, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/say/says}, and refuses to stop. But in these far reaches, in territory not commonly checked, other predators intrude. When a young, inexperienced cougar charges the patrol, s_c should have been able to run fast enoguh to escape. Should.

history_text.reg_death: This cat was killed after continuing to patrol the far border while injured by a young, inexperienced cougar.
history_text.lead_death: by a cougar while patrolling the far border
